title: USD / JPY treads water near 156 . 00 as the year draws to an end
description: USD/JPY remains caught in near-term congestion just north of the 156.00 handle during the final week of 2025’s trading year. Yen traders are battling headwinds on multiple fronts, with the Bank of Japan (BoJ) carrying much of the vexation risk for Yen markets.

USD/JPY remains caught in near-term congestion just north of the 156.00 handle during the final week of 2025’s trading year. Yen traders are battling headwinds on multiple fronts, with the Bank of Japan (BoJ) carrying much of the vexation risk for Yen markets.

The [BoJ](https://www.fxstreet.com/macroeconomics/central-banks/boj) broke away from the pack as the only central bank raising interest [rates](https://www.fxstreet.com/rates-charts/rates) heading into the end of the year after delivering another quarter-point
